channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Russia’s Military Show of Strength Masks Economic and Diplomatic Cracks
item.description: The annual Moscow parade marking victory over Nazi Germany is expected to be the largest in years, with world leaders in attendance, as the Kremlin tr...

item.title: How Lead Edge Capital’s 750-strong army of backers powers its venture flywheel
item.description: Nimay Mehta on the New York VC firm’s unique approach to software investing.

item.title: Putin and Xi Rebuke U.S. and Vow to Strengthen Ties
item.description: The two leaders, meeting in Moscow, rejected what they described as Washington’s attempt to contain them. They also hailed their friendship.

item.title: Mistrial in Murder Case Against Michigan Officer Who Shot Motorist
item.description: The jury deadlocked in the trial of Christopher Schurr, who testified that he feared for his life when he fatally shot Patrick Lyoya during a traffic ...

item.title: Bank of England cuts rates again, citing Trump tariff tensions and slower growth
item.description: The BoE cuts rates to 4.25%, citing tariff-driven growth fears, even as it lifts UK GDP forecasts and inflation pressures ease.

item.title: CFOs need a new ‘playbook’ for tariff-fueled uncertainty
item.description: The Fed's decision to hold rates steady underscores a critical reality for business leaders, according to economists.

item.title: An air traffic controller at Newark is like ‘a 3D-chess player who can juggle a chainsaw’ with their eyes closed, ex-pilot says
item.description: Air traffic controllers are taking “trauma leave” to deal with stress after the chaos at Newark.

item.title: For Embattled Starmer, U.S.-U.K. Trade Deal Will Count as a Win
item.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has spent months nurturing his relationship with President Trump. Is that about to pay off?

item.title: Melinda French Gates says the Gates Foundation’s commitment to spend its entire $200 billion on global health by 2045 is ‘fantastic’: ‘The vast majority of resources were to go back to society’
item.description: French Gates has played a pivotal role in global health since the turn of the century.

item.title: U.S. Trade Deal Could Help UK Economy, but Won’t Transform It
item.description: The deal could help some sectors and boost confidence among consumers and businesses, but the British economy faces other challenges.

item.title: Putin and Xi Rebuke U.S. and Vow to Strengthen Ties
item.description: The two leaders, meeting in Moscow, rejected what they described as Washington’s attempt to contain them. They also hailed their friendship.

item.title: Trump Administration to Announce Trade Deal With Britain
item.description: A deal would be a positive sign for both governments, which have eyed an agreement since President Trump’s first term.

item.title: Live Updates: Expectant Crowd Waits as Cardinals Deliberate Over Next Pope
item.description: Black smoke above the Sistine Chapel signaled that balloting in the morning was inconclusive. The conclave is expected to resume voting on Thursday af...

item.title: For Embattled Starmer, U.S.-U.K. Trade Deal Will Count as a Win
item.description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has spent months nurturing his relationship with President Trump. Is that about to pay off?

item.title: The Sistine Chapel hasn’t always been home to the conclave.
